name: WinGet-PSADT-GUI-Tool
description: WinGet-PSADT-GUI-Tool is a Windows PowerShell WPF GUI that streamlines Win32 app packaging and Intune deployment. It integrates WinGet search, installer download, PSADT scaffolding, and GUI-driven configuration of install/uninstall/repair logic, enabling generation of .intunewin packages and direct upload to Intune via Microsoft Graph. It outputs standard PSADT/Intune artifacts and provides live monitoring of packaging and upload steps.
author: Dhiraj Dhote

securityCheck.aiSummary: The WinGet-PSADT-GUI-Tool shows typical admin-tool behavior with legitimate module loading and GUI startup. However, notable security considerations include: (1) existence of an encoded-commands pattern (obfuscation) in a helper function, (2) runtime remote module installation from PSGallery which could introduce supply-chain risk, and (3) execution policy bypass in the launcher which lowers defense-in-depth. No evidence of credential theft, data exfiltration, or hardcoded secrets in the provided code. Recommendations: sign all scripts, avoid or minimize -ExecutionPolicy Bypass, verify modules via signing or checksum validation, and consider removing or auditing the dot-sourcing startup approach to ensure only trusted components are loaded.
